[*Brocard’s problem*]{}, first posed by Henri Brocard in 1876, asks for
factorials that are one less than a square, that is, solutions to the
equation $n! + 1 = m^2$. Only three solutions are known: $4! + 1 = 5^2$,
$5! + 1 = 11^2$ and $7! + 1 = 71^2$. Srinivasa Ramanujan also pondered
the problem, in 1913. Erdős believed that there are no other solutions,
and no more have been found for $n$ up to $10^9$.
